ygData.subject: Re: [eqenchanters] attention jewelers
ygData.msgSnippet: It is a tinkered item. Go to Fulcrums site on www.eqportal.com/tinkering for details. Last I heard it did not seem to do anything as yet. Devo
ygData.messageBody:
It is a tinkered item.
Go to Fulcrums site on www.eqportal.com/tinkering for details.
Last I heard it did not seem to do anything as yet.


"Devo" <devo@...>

05/22/00 09:16 PM
Please respond to eqenchanters

       
        To:        <eqenchanters@egroups.com>
        cc:        
        Subject:        Re: [eqenchanters] attention jewelers


where is or what is a Gemcutter?

----- Original Message -----
From: Garett <osmosis@...>
To: <eqenchanters@egroups.com>
Sent: Monday, May 22, 2000 8:58 PM
Subject: [eqenchanters] attention jewelers


> I quote this from the eqtinkers mailing list...
>
> <snip>
> Okie, take this with a grain of salt, becasue I haven't verified it..
>
> Talking to an enchanter friend of mine over the water-cooler at work, and
> he gave me the following info about a gemcutter that he borrowed.
>
> Take one gem (he was using rubies), with it in the cursor right click on
> the gemcutter.
> The gem should now be "A fine ruby" (or whatever)
> Combine the fine ruby as you would any other gem + metal ( he was making
> plat ruby veils)
> Aparently the fine gems make the same items as the regular one, but have a
> lower trivial and therefore higher success rate..
>
> Should be easy enough to verify, as it's not destructive and doesnt
involve
> combing the gemcutter with anything, and you can always try with a cheap
> gem.. Anyone got one in the bank?
>
> <snip>
>
> Time to go and support your friendly neighborhood tinker, me thinks :)
>
> Cogg - RZ
> Master tinker/jeweler/brewer/beggar/enchanter
>
>
>
>
